title: Fix admin portal access for finproledge@gmail.com

requirements.text: Ensure that a user authenticated with the email finproledge@gmail.com is reliably granted admin access in the AdminGuard component, bypassing or correctly resolving the backend role check so the admin portal renders without being blocked or redirected.

quotes: can you check if finproledge@gmail.com can access the admin portal this time before we push to production?

acceptanceCriteria: A user whose verified email is finproledge@gmail.com can navigate to the admin portal without being shown a 'not authorized' or login-prompt screen.
AdminGuard correctly identifies finproledge@gmail.com as an admin during the email-verification fallback path.
The admin portal tabs (service requests, documents, approvals, payments, deliverables, analytics) are all visible and functional for finproledge@gmail.com.
No regression: users without admin privileges are still blocked by AdminGuard.

requirements.text: Ensure the Navigation component also surfaces admin-only links (e.g., Admin Dashboard) when the authenticated user's email is finproledge@gmail.com, consistent with the AdminGuard fix.

quotes: can you check if finproledge@gmail.com can access the admin portal this time

acceptanceCriteria: Admin navigation links are visible in the top nav bar when logged in as finproledge@gmail.com.
Admin navigation links remain hidden for non-admin users.

requirements.text: Audit and fix the backend role-check logic so that the principal associated with finproledge@gmail.com is recognised as an admin by the isAdmin (or equivalent) backend function, ensuring AdminGuard's backend query path also succeeds for this user.

quotes: can you check if finproledge@gmail.com can access the admin portal this time before we push to production?

acceptanceCriteria: The backend returns true for isAdmin (or equivalent) when called by the principal linked to finproledge@gmail.com.
The fix does not grant admin rights to any other unintended principal.
Existing admin principals continue to be recognised correctly.

constraints: Do not alter immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not remove or weaken access controls for non-admin users.
Keep all Motoko logic within the single main actor file (backend/main.mo).
nonGoals: Adding new admin features or dashboard tabs.
Changing the authentication provider (Internet Identity remains the sole auth mechanism).
Modifying any user-facing design or styling.
